intro: Pilidiostigma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered pilidiostigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, featuring woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical characteristics include a compact growth habit and a preference for well-drained soils. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
